Name: Trucks, More Than Thirty Three Feet
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to prohibiting trucks which are more than thirty-three feet in length from certain areas of the city.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

   	Section one. Chapter 2 of title 19 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding thereto a new section 19-213 to read as follows:
    	�19-213. a. For purposes of this section "truck" shall mean any vehicle or combination of vehicles designated for the transportation of property, which has either of the following characteristics: two axles, six tires; or three or more axles. 
    	b. Trucks of certain lengths prohibited from certain areas. Notwithstanding any other provision of law to the contrary, and except as authorized pursuant to a special permit issued by the department or unless directed to do so by a police officer or traffic enforcement agent, no truck measuring more than thirty-three feet in length shall be permitted to operate within the following areas:                                           
    	1. In the area within the borough of Manhattan bounded by the south side of canal street, the south side of houston street, the west side of bowery and the east side of avenue of the americas.
    	2. In the area within the borough of Manhattan bounded by the south side of worth street, the south side of canal street, the west side of baxter street and the east side of bowery.
    	3. A violation of this section shall be punishable by a penalty of one hundred dollars, in addition to any other penalty provided by law.
	�2. This local law shall take effect immediately.  

    	


LS #4352
03/05/97
